Question_1.Context: Fermentation is known to have various benefits, including improving health status.
Question_1.Question: Which of the following is a key benefit associated with the consumption of fermented products?
Question_1.Source: Over the years, scientific research has associated the consumption of fermented products with improved health status. The fermentation process helps to break down compounds into more easily digestible forms. It also helps to reduce the amount of toxins and pathogens in food.

Question_2.Context: Fermentation has been linked to various health benefits, including lowering cholesterol levels.
Question_2.Question: Which enzyme is secreted by LABs during fermentation to alleviate cholesterol assimilation in the intestine?
Question_2.Source: EPSs derived from LABs exhibit their anti-cholesterol activity by alleviating cholesterol assimilation in the intestine and inducing the release of bile acids.

Question_3.Context: Fermented dairy products have been associated with various health benefits.
Question_3.Question: Which bioactive compound found in fermented dairy products has an anti-hypertensive effect?
Question_3.Source: The anti-hypertensive effect is also induced by several bioactive compounds in fermented dairy, including valyl-prolyl-proline and isoleucyl-prolyl-proline.

Question_4.Context: Fermentation technology has been utilized to produce various valuable by-products.
Question_4.Question: Which fermentation technique involves utilizing solid support rather than a liquid to produce microorganism metabolites?
Question_4.Source: Solid-state fermentation (SSF) involves utilizing solid support rather than a liquid to produce microorganism metabolites.

Question_5.Context: Fermentation has been recognized for its potential to reduce waste and increase efficiency in food production.
Question_5.Question: Which emerging technology has been employed by wineries to enhance wine aroma, flavor, and color?
Question_5.Source: Ultrasound waves that exceed 20 kHz have emerged as an eco-friendly option for processing agri-foods. This sound technology applies a cavitation process, during the formation of bubbles and their burst, leading to a sterilization effect on food and drink products.

Question_6.Context: Fermentation technology has been utilized to produce various valuable by-products.
Question_6.Question: Which enzyme has been produced by microbial fermentation of food waste?
Question_6.Source: β-glucosidase enzyme using brewer´s spent grain (BSG) as substrate.

Question_7.Context: Fermentation has been associated with reducing waste and developing high-value bioproducts.
Question_7.Question: Which bioproduct has been produced by microbial fermentation of food waste?
Question_7.Source: Antioxidant peptides using microorganism fermentation and turbot skin as substrate.

Question_8.Context: Fermentation has been recognized for its potential to reduce waste and increase efficiency in food production.
Question_8.Question: Which fermentation technique is more commonly used in industrial-scale fermentation due to its low cost and high productivity?
Question_8.Source: Due to its low cost, high productivity, and simplicity, submerged fermentation is more commonly used in industrial-scale fermentation.

Question_9.Context: Fermentation has been linked to various health benefits, including improving intestinal health.
Question_9.Question: Which short-chain fatty acids derived from dietary fiber fermentation can positively impact intestinal health?
Question_9.A: Butyric acid, propionic acid, and acetic acid
Question_9.B: Lactic acid, malic acid, and citric acid
Question_9.C: Stearic acid, oleic acid, and linoleic acid
Question_9.D: Palmitic acid, linolenic acid, and arachidonic acid
Question_9.Source: Intestinal health can be positively impacted by short-chain fatty acids including butyric acid, propionic acid, and acetic acid derived from dietary fiber fermentation.

Question_10.Context: Fermentation has been associated with various health benefits, including reducing the risk of non-communicable diseases.
Question_10.Question: Which type of food has been linked to a lower incidence of cardiovascular diseases?
Question_10.Source: Intake of fermented dairy was correlated with a lower incidence of cardiovascular diseases.
